metadata.title: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir Full Broadcast - Nov. 20, 2025
metadata.author: ABC News

David Moore, ABC's World News Tonight, America's most watched newscast, now streaming same day with all the breaking news of the day on Disney Plus, most watched, most trusted, now on Disney Plus every night. "Today, the breaking news is we come on the chilling new images, the engine coming off the plane. This is moments before the crash in Louisville killing 14 people. Authorities now pointing to these dramatic new images tonight showing the plane's final moments. Also tonight, the president calling several Democrats in Congress, most of the veterans, traders in a post, then in another saying this is punishable by death. After they put out a video telling service members that they can refuse, quote, illegal orders. Tonight, the White House has asked, given the president's words in these posts and in this environment, does the president want to execute members of Congress? How the White House answered. Tonight two suspects labeled domestic terrorists after an immigration crackdown accused of ramming into Border Patrol officers. Now the defense says the officers swerved into one of them before opening fire and that appearing to brag about the shooting and text messages that followed. Tonight the president has signed the Jeffrey Epstein bill into law. The clock has begun 30 days now to release the files. Tonight even some Republican members of Congress warning against any potential attempts to slow this down. Tonight the images of that 18-year-old girl her body being carried off a carnival cruise ship. The investigation now after a source says she was found wrapped in a blanket and under life s. What we've now learned in this case tonight. The flash flood emergency at this hour and the potential storm system that could disrupt Thanksgiving week travel. The Lee Goldberg is standing by with our first look at the Thanksgiving forecast. The major fire erupting at a climate change conference the images tonight people running to safety. The high speed chase for a murder suspect accused of killing two brothers, two teenagers. The suspect reaching speeds of 117 miles per hour, what officers had to do. The daring effort to save a shark at one point you'll see the image, one rescuer reaching his arm right into the shark's mouth. What they were trying to do. Tonight in Washington, the funeral for former Vice President Dick Cheney, a rare moment of warmth between members of both parties and what former President Bush said about his VP. And America's strong tonight, one week now, before Thanksgiving and Deborah Roberts is here, with one extraordinary effort to put dinner on the table and how you can help. From ABC News, World Headquarters, and New York, this is World News Tonight with David New York. Good evening. We begin tonight here with these chilling new images now released of that deadly crash. The engine coming right off the plane moments before it went down in Louisville killing 14 people. The NTSB tonight releasing harrowing photos of the plane's final seconds. Flames scene coming from the left wing as it leaves the runway. You can see the engine breaking apart that engine clearly separating from the wing. The fire spreading the pilots unable to abort takeoff at this point. That UPS plane crashing just seconds after takeoff, Mola Lengue, leading us off tonight with these new images. Tonight the NTSB revealing horrifying frame by frame images. The clearest look yet at the moment, the left engine broke off a UPS cargo plane wing as it took off from Louisville airport and then exploded. Airport surveillance photos show the plane taking off with the engine intact. Then the engine breaks away and snaps upward erupting in flames that spread to the rest of the plane. Flite 2970. The NTSB recovering these crucial parts of the plane from the scene. Now, zeroing in on the 34-year-old MD-11's left pylon, the component that attaches the engine to the wing, reporting they found evidence of fatigue cracks in addition to areas of fire. We do know that the aircraft underwent some maintenance two weeks prior where they were supposed to look at this area, but you can't always visually identify these kinds of fatigue cracks. They're very, very fine and often takes an X-ray machine to find them. The NTSB, Boeing and the FAA, grounding all MD-11's, MD-10's, and DC-10's while they investigate whether the problem is widespread. Investigators also noted similarities between this disaster and the ninth 1779 Chicago crash of American Airlines Flight 191, a DC-10 that killed 273 people just after takeoff. Well, David, as the crash investigation continues, a final report from the NTSB is expected in 18 to 24 months, David. Mola Lengie leading us off here tonight. Mola, thank you. Tonight the White House dialing back President Trump's own words today. The President calling several Democrats in Congress, most of them veterans, traders in a post, and then in another post saying this is punishable by death. After they put out a video telling service members they can refuse, quote, illegal orders. The White House was asked in this environment, what is the President suggesting? Here's Rachel Scott. Tonight, President Trump criticized by members of both parties, after calling six Democratic members of Congress, "traders" and accusing them of seditious behavior punishable by death. It came in response to video release by the lawmakers, all of whom served in the military or in US intelligence. I was a captain in the United States Navy, former CIA officer, former Navy. In the video, the lawmakers reminding members of the military they should not obey illegal orders. Our laws are clear. You can refuse illegal orders. You must refuse illegal orders. No one has to carry out orders that violate the law or our Constitution. The lawmakers did not specify which orders they were talking about, but the president enraged. Posting a flurry of messages on social media saying they should be arrested and put on trial. The words cannot be allowed to stand adding an example must be said. The president then writing, "Ceudicious behavior punishable by death." And he reposted a message from another account that said, "Hang them." George Washington would. Democrats accusing the president of inciting violence. This puts all of our lives in jeopardy. What are we all doing right now? Democrats in the Congress are on the phone. With their chiefs of staff beefing up our security for this weekend and next week because the president has a lot of unhinged supporters out there. Republicans clearly uncomfortable. The words that the president chose are not the ones that I would use. Okay? Obviously, I don't think that these are crimes punishable by death or any of that. Okay? Republican Senator Rand Paul was blunt. That kind of rhetoric isn't good. It stirs up people among us who may not be stable, who may think, "Well, home traders, reason why we do traders is that it's a death penalty. Maybe I'll just take matters into my own hands, which is not something we should be encouraging." No. Let's be clear about what the president is responding to. Levit saying the six Democrats are the ones inciting violence. Thanks, Victor. We turn now to the funeral today for former Vice President Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful and polarizing Vice President in U.S. history. And a rare moment today, Republican and Democratic leaders coming together to remember. John Carl was there. At the National Cathedral today, all five living Vice Presidents gathered to honor the memory of the man considered to be the most powerful Vice President of all, Dick Cheney. They shook hands at the front of the cathedral, Joe Biden arriving with Jill Biden, George W. Bush with Laura Bush, former Vice President Kamala Harris, a rare display of warmth across party lines. President George W. Bush praised Cheney as an American patriot. This was a Vice President totally devoted to protecting the United States and its interests. President Trump and Vice President and JD Vance were not invited. Not surprising, considering Cheney had said in the last election, "There has never been an individual who is a greater threat to our republic than Donald Trump." Cheney crossed party lines and endorsed Kamala Harris for president. His daughter Liz Cheney, lost her seat in Congress after she investigated January 6th, spoke of her father's love of country over party. He knew that bonds of party must always yield to the single bond we share as Americans. David, I was there at the service today. It was striking to see so many major figures from the Democratic and Republican parties. Most of them from the past, but gathered there for a single purpose. It's the kind of thing you just don't see much these days. David. John Carl in Washington, we appreciate it, John. Thank you.
